declarations.name: addAnimationController
declarations.description:
Creates and attaches an animation player instance to the passed in `host` element.
The player will run animations on the passed in `target`, or if `target` is undefined,
the host element itself.

declarations.description:
The Combo component is similar to the Select component in that it provides a list of options from which the user can make a selection.
In contrast to the Select component, the Combo component displays all options in a virtualized list of items,
meaning the combo box can simultaneously show thousands of options, where one or more options can be selected.
Additionally, users can create custom item templates, allowing for robust data visualization.
The Combo component features case-sensitive filtering, grouping, complex data binding, dynamic addition of values and more.
declarations.name: IgcComboComponent

declarations.name: getOffset
declarations.description:
Returns an element's offset relative to its parent. Similar to element.offsetTop and element.offsetLeft, except the
parent doesn't have to be positioned relative or absolute.

Work around for the following issues in Chromium based browsers:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1330819
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1334556

declarations.name: isLTR
declarations.description: Returns whether an element has a Left-to-Right directionality.

declarations.name: formatString
declarations.description:
Builds a string from format specifiers and replacement parameters.
Will coerce non-string parameters to their string representations.

declarations.name: asNumber
declarations.description: Parse the passed `value` as a number or return the `fallback` if it can't be done.

declarations.name: wrap
declarations.description:
Returns the value wrapped between the min and max bounds.

If the value is greater than max, returns the min and vice-versa.
If the value is between the bounds, it is returned unchanged.

declarations.name: requiredValidator
requiredNumberValidator
requiredBooleanValidator
minLengthValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'tooShort',
  message: ({ minLength }) =>
    formatString(validatorMessages.minLength, minLength),
  isValid: ({ minLength, value }) =>
    minLength ? value.length >= minLength : true,
}

declarations.name: maxLengthValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'tooLong',
  message: ({ maxLength }) =>
    formatString(validatorMessages.maxLength, maxLength),
  isValid: ({ maxLength, value }) =>
    maxLength ? value.length <= maxLength : true,
}

declarations.name: patternValidator
minValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'rangeUnderflow',
  message: ({ min }) => formatString(validatorMessages.min, min),
  isValid: ({ min, value }) =>
    isDefined(min)
      ? isDefined(value) && asNumber(value) >= asNumber(min)
      : true,
}

declarations.name: maxValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'rangeOverflow',
  message: ({ max }) => formatString(validatorMessages.max, max),
  isValid: ({ max, value }) =>
    isDefined(max)
      ? isDefined(value) && asNumber(value) <= asNumber(max)
      : true,
}

declarations.name: stepValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'stepMismatch',
  message: 'Value does not conform to step constraint',
  isValid: ({ min, step, value }) =>
    isDefined(step)
      ? (asNumber(value) - asNumber(min)) % asNumber(step, 1) === 0
      : true,
}

declarations.name: emailValidator
urlValidator
minDateValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'rangeUnderflow',
  message: ({ min }) => formatString(validatorMessages.min, min),
  isValid: ({ value, min }) =>
    min
      ? !DateTimeUtil.lessThanMinValue(value ?? new Date(), min, false, true)
      : true,
}

declarations.name: maxDateValidator
declarations.default:
{
  key: 'rangeOverflow',
  message: ({ max }) => formatString(validatorMessages.max, max),
  isValid: ({ value, max }) =>
    max
      ? !DateTimeUtil.greaterThanMaxValue(value ?? new Date(), max, false, true)
      : true,
}

members.name: validators
members.default:
[
    requiredValidator,

    {
      ...minDateValidator,
      isValid: () =>
        this.min
          ? !DateTimeUtil.lessThanMinValue(
              this.value || new Date(),
              this.min,
              this.hasTimeParts,
              this.hasDateParts
            )
          : true,
    },
    {
      ...maxDateValidator,
      isValid: () =>
        this.max
          ? !DateTimeUtil.greaterThanMaxValue(
              this.value || new Date(),
              this.max,
              this.hasTimeParts,
              this.hasDateParts
            )
          : true,
    },
  ]

Used for defining gradient stops in the igc-circular-progress.

members.description:
The maximum value for the rating.

If there are projected symbols, the maximum value will be resolved
based on the number of symbols.

members.name: step
members.description:
The minimum value change allowed.

Valid values are in the interval between 0 and 1 inclusive.

members.name: valueFormat
members.description:
A format string which sets aria-valuetext. Instances of '{0}' will be replaced
with the current value of the control and instances of '{1}' with the maximum value for the control.

Important for screen-readers and useful for localization.

members.description: The aria label of the upper thumb.

members.name: min
members.description:
The minimum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 0.

If `min` is greater than `max` the call is a no-op.

If `labels` are provided (projected), then `min` is always set to 0.

If `lowerBound` ends up being less than than the current `min` value,
it is automatically assigned the new `min` value.

members.name: max
members.description:
The maximum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 100.

If `max` is less than `min` the call is a no-op.

If `labels` are provided (projected), then `max` is always set to
the number of labels.

If `upperBound` ends up being greater than than the current `max` value,
it is automatically assigned the new `max` value.

members.name: lowerBound
members.description: The lower bound of the slider value. If not set, the `min` value is applied.

members.name: upperBound
members.description: The upper bound of the slider value. If not set, the `max` value is applied.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the UI interactions of the slider.

members.name: discreteTrack
members.description:
Marks the slider track as discrete so it displays the steps.
If the `step` is 0, the slider will remain continuos even if `discreteTrack` is `true`.

members.name: hideTooltip
members.description: Hides the thumb tooltip.

members.name: step
members.description:
Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.

If set to 0 no stepping is implied and any value in the range is allowed.
If `labels` are provided (projected) then the step is always assumed to be 1 since it is a discrete slider.

members.name: primaryTicks
members.description: The number of primary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no primary ticks are displayed.

members.name: secondaryTicks
members.description: The number of secondary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no secondary ticks are displayed.

members.name: tickOrientation
members.description: Changes the orientation of the ticks.

members.name: hidePrimaryLabels
members.description: Hides the primary tick labels.

members.name: hideSecondaryLabels
members.description: Hides the secondary tick labels.

members.name: locale
members.description: The locale used to format the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: valueFormat
members.description: String format used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: valueFormatOptions
members.description: Number format options used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: tickLabelRotation
members.description: The degrees for the rotation of the tick labels. Defaults to 0.

members.description: Decrements the value of the slider by `stepDecrement * step`, where `stepDecrement` defaults to 1.

members.description:
Applies the FormAssociatedElementInterface.invalid| `invalid` attribute on the control and the associated styles
if the element has completed the first update cycle or it has been interacted with by the user.

members.name: reportValidity
members.description: Checks for validity of the control and shows the browser message if it invalid.

members.name: checkValidity
members.description: Checks for validity of the control and emits the invalid event if it invalid.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Sets a custom validation message for the control.

members.name: min
members.description:
The minimum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 0.

If `min` is greater than `max` the call is a no-op.

If `labels` are provided (projected), then `min` is always set to 0.

If `lowerBound` ends up being less than than the current `min` value,
it is automatically assigned the new `min` value.

members.name: max
members.description:
The maximum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 100.

If `max` is less than `min` the call is a no-op.

If `labels` are provided (projected), then `max` is always set to
the number of labels.

If `upperBound` ends up being greater than than the current `max` value,
it is automatically assigned the new `max` value.

members.name: lowerBound
members.description: The lower bound of the slider value. If not set, the `min` value is applied.

members.name: upperBound
members.description: The upper bound of the slider value. If not set, the `max` value is applied.

members.name: discreteTrack
members.description:
Marks the slider track as discrete so it displays the steps.
If the `step` is 0, the slider will remain continuos even if `discreteTrack` is `true`.

members.name: hideTooltip
members.description: Hides the thumb tooltip.

members.name: step
members.description:
Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.

If set to 0 no stepping is implied and any value in the range is allowed.
If `labels` are provided (projected) then the step is always assumed to be 1 since it is a discrete slider.

members.name: primaryTicks
members.description: The number of primary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no primary ticks are displayed.

members.name: secondaryTicks
members.description: The number of secondary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no secondary ticks are displayed.

members.name: tickOrientation
members.description: Changes the orientation of the ticks.

members.name: hidePrimaryLabels
members.description: Hides the primary tick labels.

members.name: hideSecondaryLabels
members.description: Hides the secondary tick labels.

members.name: locale
members.description: The locale used to format the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: valueFormat
members.description: String format used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: valueFormatOptions
members.description: Number format options used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

members.name: tickLabelRotation
members.description: The degrees for the rotation of the tick labels. Defaults to 0.

members.description:
Specifies what if any permission the browser has to provide for automated assistance in filling out form field values,
as well as guidance to the browser as to the type of information expected in the field.
Refer to [this page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for additional information.

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description:
Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

[MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize).

members.name: inputMode
members.description:
Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents.
This allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.

[MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode)

The tree allows users to represent hierarchical data in a tree-view structure,
maintaining parent-child relationships, as well as to define static tree-view structure without a corresponding data model.

declarations.description:
A controller class which determines whether a focus ring should be shown to indicate keyboard focus.
Focus rings are visible only when the user is interacting with a keyboard, not with a mouse, touch, or other input methods.

By default the class attaches a keyup event handler on the component host and will update its keyboard focus
state based on it.
declarations.name: KeyboardFocusRingController

members.name: focused
members.description: Gets whether the current focus state is activated through a keyboard interaction.

members.name: reset
members.description:
Resets the keyboard focus state.

Usually called on blur of the component or when a pointer based interaction
is executed.

declarations.name: addKeyboardFocusRing
declarations.description: Adds a KeyboardFocusRingController responsible for managing keyboard focus state.

declarations.name: addKeybindings
declarations.description:
Creates a keybinding controller and adds to it to the passed `element`
with the provided `options`.

declarations.name: createMutationController
declarations.description:
Creates and attaches a mutation controller with `config` to the passed in `host`.

Automatically starts/stops observing for mutation changes
in the respective component connect/disconnect callbacks.

The mutation observer is disconnected before invoking the passed in callback and re-attached
after that in order to not loop itself in endless stream of changes.
